intro: Rudgea isthmensis, commonly known as the Isthmus rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rudgea isthmensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
